body:

ursa is ok
but minecraft-protocol is not working
here is log

comment_data.body:
The tests don't pass because you're not running them correctly. You need to set some environment variables with your minecraft username/password and location of the server jar.

https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/master/test/test.js#L15
https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/master/test/test.js#L312

I think it *might* be a good idea to remove those tests, as they aren't unit tests but integration tests (and even then, I doubt they serve too much purpose).

As for the ForbiddenOperationException, it's thrown in yggdrasil because the login server didn't answer with a 200 OK, meaning you failed to auth. http://wiki.vg/Authentication#Errors

Those integration tests are documented here: https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol#testing

I'm not sure why you want to remove them. They may not be perfect, but they have a purpose: check if the library definitely works against the real server.

I use the this username and password registered in minecraft.
Everthing works ok.
The server shows:

```
[20:19:24] [Server thread/INFO]: name[/127.0.0.1:50378] logged in with entity id
 1347 at ([world] 127.5, 64.0, 248.5)
Oct 15, 2014 8:19:24 PM com.earth2me.essentials.EssentialsConf$WriteRunner run
信息: 创建空的配置:D:\minecraft\server\plugins\Essentials\userdata\name.yml
Oct 15, 2014 8:19:25 PM org.bukkit.plugin.PluginLogger log
信息: [Essentials] Lag Notice - Slow Economy Response - Request took over 26.021
ms!
[20:19:34] [Server thread/INFO]: name issued server command: /register pass12312
3 pass123123
Oct 15, 2014 8:19:34 PM fr.xephi.authme.ConsoleLogger info
信息: name registered 127.0.0.1
```

but when I use "node client_chat.js 127.0.0.1 name pass123123",The server shows nothing.
And node occurs error.

```
D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\examples>node client_chat.js 127.
0.0.1 name pass123123
connecting to 127.0.0.1:25565
user: name

events.js:72
        throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
              ^
Error: ForbiddenOperationException
    at D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\lib\yggdrasil.js:51:23
    at Request.callback (D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\node_modules\superagent\lib\node\index.js:575:3)
    at Request.<anonymous> (D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\node_modules\superagent\lib\node\index.js:133:10)
    at Request.emit (events.js:95:17)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\node_modules\superagent\lib\node\index.js:703:12)
    at IncomingMessage.emit (events.js:117:20)
    at _stream_readable.js:943:16
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:419:13)
```

please help me.

@roblabla Yeah, I know they can be improved. But I think it's important to test it against the real server. I really do not think that unit tests we currently have can replace the integration tests. The *does not crash for ...* surely must be replaced by a more rigorous test. But that's what we have for now.

I would not go so far as to completely remove them. Just my opinion.

@roblabla 
Do you mean the account must registered in mojang?
Well I read "yggdrasil.js",I guess it is.
But I want login a account not registered in mojang.
In "server.properties" I also set "online-mode=false".

Is there a way to make node-minecraft-protocol use 3rd-party account?

Then you need to put online: true in the options hash of createClient. Look at the test cases for more info on offline-mode support

On October 16, 2014 7:11:13 AM CEST, mercurylmy <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>@roblabla 
>Do you mean the account must registered in mojang?
>Well I read "yggdrasil.js",I guess it is.
>But I want login a account not registered in mojang.
>In "server.properties" I also set "online-mode=false".
>
>Is there a way to make node-minecraft-protocol use 3rd-party account?
>
>
>---
>Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
>https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/issues/101#issuecomment-59314841

-- 
Sent from my Android phone with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.

https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/blob/master/index.js#L231

In other words, don't pass a password or accessToken in the options hash and you should be able to connect in offline-mode.

@roblabla 
I replaced "  if (haveCredentials) {" by "  if (false) {".

And run "node client_chat.js 127.0.0.1 user99 pass123123".
It shows:


D:\basket\node\node_modules\minecraft-protocol\examples>node client_chat.js 127.
0.0.1 user99 pass123123
connecting to 127.0.0.1:25565
user: user99
Successfully connected to 127.0.0.1:25565



But craftbukkit server is not respond anything.
No file created in server\world\players\.

What went wrong?
I guess try again ? What version of minecraft are you using ? We are only 1.7.10-compatible right now, and nothing else... probably.

Oh……I use craftbukkit for minecraft-1.6.4.

And I try another server for minecraft-1.7.10.
It finally works!!!
It shows the server welcome info.But can't register a new account automatic.


So……How can add compatibility to old version?
Thanks.
You need to rollback to version 0.11.6, as the readme states. https://github.com/andrewrk/node-minecraft-protocol/tree/0.11.6

title: windows install issue
